p: What we also know from intensive research is that T1D is a heterogeneous disease. Over the past decades, childhood T1D has increased worldwide at an estimated average annual rate of 3.9%; such doubling during the last 20 years is too high to result only from genetic causes [ 5, 6, 7]. Firstly, the concordance rate between monogenetic twins is only about 50% [ 8]. Secondly, epidemiological studies have shown that the diseaseâ€™s incidence follows a periodic pattern within the population [ 5, 6, 9] with a significant geographical variation [ 6].
